newsitem.title: JAPAN: Sharp sees 97/98 capital spending on chips Y74 bln.
newsitem.headline: Sharp sees 97/98 capital spending on chips Y74 bln.

text.p: Sharp Corp said on Wednesday that it plans capital spending of 74 billion yen in its semiconductor business in the year from April 1, while capital investment in its liquid crystal display business in the year will total 49 billion yen.

The planned 74 billion yen investment in its chip business for 1997/98 is the same as its estimated capital investment in that business in 1996/97, Sharp president Haruo Tsuji said in a news conference.
Sharp's capital investment in its LCD business for 1996/97 is estimated at 38 billion yen, which is a larger sum than the company originally expected, Tsuji said.
Tsuji said Sharp aimed for 345 billion yen worth of LCD output in 1997/98, up from an estimated 240 billion yen in 1996/97.
